title: Connections
description: Defines a connection between a subject and an object (Alice follows Bob, Alice is a programmer, etc.). In Graph database terminology, the connection is an edge between two nodes.

object_url.title: Object URL
object_url.description: The URL (starting with http:// or https://) of the primary URL or Murmurations Profile URL for the object (org, project, person, etc.)

type.title: Relationship Type
type.description: A declaration, action or link that describes the relationship (e.g., is a, has a, trusts, "follows", <https://schema.org/knows>, etc.)

qualifiers.title: Qualifiers
qualifiers.description: Qualifies the relationship (e.g., adjectives ("is a _good_ programmer") or prepositional phrases such as "Alice follows Bob _on Twitter_" or "Bob trusts Alice _to hold his keys_")

type.title: Type of Qualifier
type.description: Adjective, prepositional phrase, other parts of speech

condition.title: Conditions of Qualifier
condition.description: Defines conditions for the qualifier (e.g., "Bob trusts Alice to hold his keys _until the end of the year_", "Bob trusts Alice to return his keys _when locked out of the house_")

id.title: Unique Identifier
id.description: A unique ID for the subject created by the object (e.g., your member ID in an organization, login name to a website, etc.)

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: The domain to which a strength rating is being applied

strength.title: Strength
strength.description: The strength of knowledge, expertise, etc. in the specified domain (scale of 0 to 100)

data.title: Other Data
data.description: Data payload associated with the relationship

object_url.title: Object URL
object_url.description: The URL (starting with http:// or https://) of the primary URL or Murmurations Profile URL for the object (org, project, person, etc.)

metadata.purpose: Defines a connection between two entities and quantifies their relationship from the point of view of the subject.
